reports.title: The municipalities of Guadalajara and Antalya exchange on waste ...
reports.content: Two webinars were organized on Thursday 12 and Friday 13 December to enable an exchange of experiences between the cities of Guadalajara (Mexico) and Antalya (Türkiye). These one-hour sessions, focusing on the best practices implemented by both cities in waste management, were held within the framework of the project MetroResilience Guadalajara, funded by the European Union through the Partnership for Sustainable Cities call. [...] The MetroResilience Guadalaraja project is implemented by the Metropolitan Area of ​​Guadalajara (AMG), through the Institute for Planning and Management of the Development of the Metropolitan Area of ​​Guadalajara (IMEPLAN) and the Barcelona  Metropolitan Area (AMB). It aims to reinforce the metropolitan governance of the metropolitan area of Guadalajara in urban resilience and management of solid waste. One of the activities planned in the project consists in the implementation of nine urban [...] green points to better sort waste and raise awareness among citizens about the importance of good waste management. During the first session, Guadalajara presented the developments of this activity.
